thread.title: Colorado Town Getting A Drive-Through Marijuana Shop
thread.title_full: Colorado Town Getting A Drive-Through Marijuana Shop

author: CBS Sacramento
title: Colorado Town Getting A Drive-Through Marijuana Shop

organizations.name: colorado town getting a drive-through marijuana shop colorado town

text:
Colorado Town Getting A Drive-Through Marijuana Shop February 19, 2017 4:34 PM SAN FRANCISCO - JULY 13: Containers of medicinal marijuana are seen on display at the Alternative Herbal Health Services cannabis dispensary July 13, 2006 in San Francisco. San Francisco city planners are deciding July 13 if they will issue a permit to allow Kevin Reed to open the Green Cross medical marijuana dispensary right in the middle of San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf area, a popular tourist destination. (Photo by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images) 
PARACHUTE, Colo. (AP) — The western Colorado town of Parachute is getting a drive-through marijuana shop believed to be the first in the state. 
The Glenwood Springs Post Independent reported Saturday ( http://bit.ly/2m1PZCA ) the Parachute Board of Trustees approved a business license for Tumbleweed Express last week. 
It’s expected to open in March in a former car wash. 
The business also had to get approval from the state Marijuana Enforcement Division. 
The division says Tumbleweed Express cannot allow anyone younger than 21 on the premises, even in the back seat of a car. The business must also have security and surveillance and marijuana may not be visible from outside the dispensary. 
Parachute Town Manager Stuart McArthur says marijuana accounted for nearly 30 percent of the community’s 2016 sales tax revenue of just over $1 million.
